<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_open_:
```c
static int lfs_dir_open_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir, const char *path) {
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &dir->m, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }

    if (lfs_tag_type3(tag) != LFS_TYPE_DIR) {
        return LFS_ERR_NOTDIR;
    }

    lfs_block_t pair[2];
    if (lfs_tag_id(tag) == 0x3ff) {
        // handle root dir separately
        pair[0] = lfs->root[0];
        pair[1] = lfs->root[1];
    } else {
        // get dir pair from parent
        lfs_stag_t res = lfs_dir_get(lfs, &dir->m, LFS_MKTAG(0x700, 0x3ff, 0),
                LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_STRUCT, lfs_tag_id(tag), 8), pair);
        if (res < 0) {
            return res;
        }
        lfs_pair_fromle32(pair);
    }

    // fetch first pair
    int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, pair);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // setup entry
    dir->head[0] = dir->m.pair[0];
    dir->head[1] = dir->m.pair[1];
    dir->id = 0;
    dir->pos = 0;

    // add to list of mdirs
    dir->type = LFS_TYPE_DIR;
    lfs_mlist_append(lfs, (struct lfs_mlist *)dir);

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &dir->m, &path, NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call passes the address of the function parameter 'path' (a const char *). This permits lfs_dir_find to modify the pointer variable 'path' via the const char ** parameter (e.g. advance or reassign it), which would be modifying a function parameter and thus violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. To comply, make a local copy (e.g. const char *tmp = path;) and pass &tmp instead so the original parameter is not modified.
